title: Whitely King
text:
Whitely King, was a <a href="trade%20union">union</a> organizer in <a href="Australia">Australia</a> in the late 19th century. 
He is featured in the <a href="folk%20music">folk song</a> "The Shearer and the Rouseabout" by <a href="Joe%20Watson%20%28musician%29">Joe Watson</a> and the poem "<a href="Saint%20Peter%20%28poem%29">Saint Peter</a>" by <a href="Henry%20Lawson">Henry Lawson</a> (later adapted into a folk song by <a href="Peter%20Duggan">Peter Duggan</a>).
A certain kind of homemade weapon was colloquially known as a Whitely King as well, named for the man.
